1.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

2.text: “Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah,

3.text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, and understanding, and knowledge in every craft,

4.text: in order to design whatever must be fabricated from gold, and silver, and brass,

5.text: from marble, and precious stones, and various woods.

6.text: And I have given to him, as his associate, Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan. And I have placed wisdom in the heart of every artisan, so that they may make everything as I have instructed you:

7.text: the tabernacle of the covenant, and the ark of the testimony, and the propitiatory which is over it, and all the vessels of the tabernacle,

8.text: and the table and its vessels, the most pure lampstand with its vessels, and the altars of incense

9.text: and of holocaust and all their vessels, the washtub with its base,

10.text: the holy vestments for the ministry of Aaron the priest, and for his sons, so that they may execute their office of sacred rites,

11.text: the oil of unction, and the incense of aromatics in the Sanctuary. All the things that I have instructed you, they shall make.”

12.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

13.text: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: See that you keep my Sabbath. For it is a sign between me and you among your generations, so that you may know that I am the Lord, who sanctifies you.

14.text: Keep my Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Whoever will have polluted it, shall die a death. Whoever will have done any work in it, his soul shall perish from the midst of his people.

15.text: For six days you shall do work. On the seventh day, it is the Sabbath, a rest sanctified by the Lord. All who will have done work on this day shall die.

16.text: Let the sons of Israel keep the Sabbath, and let them celebrate it throughout their generations. It is an everlasting covenant

17.text: between me and the sons of Israel, and a perpetual sign. For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and in the seventh he ceased from work.”

18.text: And the Lord, having completed speaking in this way on Mount Sinai, gave to Moses two stone tablets of testimony, written with the finger of God.
